tagline: C4G Vein-to-Vein (V2V) is a system to monitor blood inventory from collection to transfusion. A collaboration between the Computing For Good (C4G) program at Georgia Tech, the CDC and participating countries.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
body:
### How to setup?

Installing for the first time:
1. Download latest version of V2V setup [here](http://c4g.cc.gatech.edu/files/v2v-latest.exe).
2. Run the setup as Administrator on a Windows computer.
3. At the end you will see an icon on your desktop called _Vein-to-Vein_. Double click this icon to run V2V. Thats it!

First time configuration:
1. Start V2V from the desktop icon _Vein-to-Vein_.

2. Log in using one of the following accounts:

   a. Admin Login
      `Username: admin`

       `Password: admin321123`

   b. Technician Login

      `Username: test`
      `Password: test`

### Support or Contact
Having trouble setting up or using V2V. Have suggestions or feedback?
Just email us at [vempala@cc.gatech.edu, rohit.banga@gatech.edu](mailto:vempala@cc.gatech.edu, rohit.banga@gatech.edu)
name: Vein-to-Vein
